trans-unit.source: Group Policy and MDM settings | Microsoft Azure
trans-unit.target: Group Policy and MDM settings | Microsoft Azure

trans-unit.source: Provides information about group policy and mobile device management (MDM) settings that should be used on corporate-owned devices.
trans-unit.target: Provides information about group policy and mobile device management (MDM) settings that should be used on corporate-owned devices.

trans-unit.source: These policies are applied to the user’s entire device.
trans-unit.target: These policies are applied to the user’s entire device.

trans-unit.source: Group Policy and MDM settings
trans-unit.target: Group Policy and MDM settings

trans-unit.source: Use these group policy and mobile device management (MDM) settings only on corporate-owned devices because these policies are applied to the user’s entire device.
trans-unit.target: Use these group policy and mobile device management (MDM) settings only on corporate-owned devices because these policies are applied to the user’s entire device.

trans-unit.source: Applying an MDM policy to disable settings sync for a personal, user-owned device will negatively impact the use of that device.
trans-unit.target: Applying an MDM policy to disable settings sync for a personal, user-owned device will negatively impact the use of that device.

trans-unit.source: Additionally, other user accounts on the device will also be affected by the policy.
trans-unit.target: Additionally, other user accounts on the device will also be affected by the policy.

trans-unit.source: Enterprises that want to manage roaming for personal (unmanaged) devices can use the Azure portal to enable or disable roaming, rather than using Group Policy or MDM.
trans-unit.target: Enterprises that want to manage roaming for personal (unmanaged) devices can use the Azure portal to enable or disable roaming, rather than using Group Policy or MDM.

trans-unit.source: The following tables describe the policy settings available.
trans-unit.target: The following tables describe the policy settings available.

trans-unit.source: MDM settings
trans-unit.target: MDM settings

trans-unit.source: The MDM policy settings apply to both Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.
trans-unit.target: The MDM policy settings apply to both Windows 10 and Windows 10 Mobile.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Allow Microsoft Account Connection
trans-unit.target: Allow Microsoft Account Connection

trans-unit.source: Allows users to authenticate using a Microsoft account on the device
trans-unit.target: Allows users to authenticate using a Microsoft account on the device

trans-unit.source: Allow Sync My Settings
trans-unit.target: Allow Sync My Settings

trans-unit.source: Allows users to roam Windows settings and app data
trans-unit.target: Allows users to roam Windows settings and app data

trans-unit.source: Group Policy settings
trans-unit.target: Group Policy settings

trans-unit.source: The Group Policy settings apply to Windows 10 devices that are joined to an Active Directory domain.
trans-unit.target: The Group Policy settings apply to Windows 10 devices that are joined to an Active Directory domain.

trans-unit.source: The table includes legacy settings that would appear to manage sync settings, but that do not work for Enterprise State Roaming for Windows 10.
trans-unit.target: The table includes legacy settings that would appear to manage sync settings, but that do not work for Enterprise State Roaming for Windows 10.

trans-unit.source: Name
trans-unit.target: Name

trans-unit.source: Description
trans-unit.target: Description

trans-unit.source: Accounts: Block Microsoft Accounts
trans-unit.target: Accounts: Block Microsoft Accounts

trans-unit.source: This policy setting prevents users from adding new Microsoft accounts on this computer
trans-unit.target: This policy setting prevents users from adding new Microsoft accounts on this computer

trans-unit.source: Do not sync
trans-unit.target: Do not sync

trans-unit.source: Allows users to roam Windows settings and app data
trans-unit.target: Allows users to roam Windows settings and app data

trans-unit.source: Do not sync personalize
trans-unit.target: Do not sync personalize

trans-unit.source: Disables syncing of the Themes group
trans-unit.target: Disables syncing of the Themes group

trans-unit.source: Do not sync browser settings
trans-unit.target: Do not sync browser settings

trans-unit.source: Disables syncing of the Internet Explorer group
trans-unit.target: Disables syncing of the Internet Explorer group

trans-unit.source: Do not sync passwords
trans-unit.target: Do not sync passwords

trans-unit.source: Disables syncing of Passwords group
trans-unit.target: Disables syncing of Passwords group

trans-unit.source: Do not sync other Windows settings
trans-unit.target: Do not sync other Windows settings

trans-unit.source: Disables syncing of Other Windows settings group
trans-unit.target: Disables syncing of Other Windows settings group

trans-unit.source: Do not sync desktop personalization
trans-unit.target: Do not sync desktop personalization

trans-unit.source: Do not use; has no effect
trans-unit.target: Do not use; has no effect

trans-unit.source: Do not sync on metered connections
trans-unit.target: Do not sync on metered connections

trans-unit.source: Disables roaming on metered connections, such as cellular 3G
trans-unit.target: Disables roaming on metered connections, such as cellular 3G

trans-unit.source: Do not sync apps
trans-unit.target: Do not sync apps

trans-unit.source: Do not use; has no effect
trans-unit.target: Do not use; has no effect

trans-unit.source: Do not sync app settings
trans-unit.target: Do not sync app settings

trans-unit.source: Disables roaming of app data
trans-unit.target: Disables roaming of app data

trans-unit.source: Do not sync start settings
trans-unit.target: Do not sync start settings

trans-unit.source: Do not use; has no effect
trans-unit.target: Do not use; has no effect
